Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora or hydria; exterior: small modelled necking ring with added red; on shoulder, band of double outlined tongues (alternating black/white/black/red); below, arcading and black dots; below, black figure decoration consisting of possibly part of wing.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 129, no. 28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.134) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
